Name: 2nd Common Language (Mandarin Chinese)
Description: The second most spoken language in the world and the most natively spoken language in the world. The primary language of China, Macau, Hong Kong, Singapore and Taiwan (though as many speak Hokkien Taiwanese)

Name: 3rd Common Language (Hindi)
Description: The third most spoken language in the world and fourth most natively spoken. The primary language of India and Fiji.

Name: 3D Printing
Description: A type of additive construction which prints 3D Objects from digital CAD or 3D Models

Name: 4th Common Language (Spanish)
Description: The second most natively spoken and fourth most spoken language overall. The primary language in Spain, Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Ecuador (Castilian), El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea (the only African country which speaks mostly Spanish though there are many Fang and Portugese speakers), Guatemala, Honduras (Honduran), Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Peru,  Uruguay, Venezuela.

Name: 5th Common Language (French)
Description: The fifth most spoken language worldwide, though most speakers are non native. Primary language of Benin (though they have a lot of Fon and Yoruba group languages), Burkina Faso, Cameroon, The Democratic Republic of Congo, Côte d’Ivoire/Ivory Coast (though Baule is highly spoken as well and the country has many languages), Gabon (though Fang is spoken heavily there as well), Monaco, Togo (though many speak Ewe as well). Useful in West, Central and South Africa.

Name: 6th Common Language (Arabic)
Description: The sixth most spoken language in the world. The primary language of Algeria, Bahrain, Chad, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait (though almost half speak English as well), Lebanon (many also speak French), Libya, Mauritania (a good number speak French too), Morocco (though most speak French as well), Oman, Qatar (though many speak English), Saudi Arabia, Sudan, Syria, Tunisia (though most also speak French), the United Arab Emirates, Western Sahara and Yemen. Spoken widely in the Middle East and Northern Africa.

Name: 7th Common Language (Bengali/Bangla)
Description: The seventh most spoken language in the world. The primary language of Bangaladesh. Spoken in Bangaladesh, as part of the 21 regional Indian languages and Sierra Leone.

Name: 8th Common Language (Russian)
Description: The eighth most spoken language in the world. The primary language of Russia, Belarus, the detached Kalniningrad Oblast Region and Kazakhstan. Widespread in Eastern Europe.

Name: 9th Common Language (Portugese)
Description: The ninth most spoken language in the world. The primary language of Portugal, Angola, Brazil, Mozambique (though a good number also speak Makhuwa), Sao Tome & Principe (though many speak Forro). Useful in Central Africa.

Name: Acting (General)
Description: Portraying a character in a dramatic work of fiction, such as a play or film

Name: Acting (Miming/Pantomime)
Description: Portraying a character without speaking, which originated in Greece

Name: Acting (Voice)
Description: Portraying a character using only your voice, typically for animated films, podcasts or audiobooks

Name: Africa Central: Language (Fang)
Description: A language spoken heavily in Equatorial Guinea and Gabon by the Fang people as part of the Bantu language group

Name: Africa Central:Language (Forro)
Description: A language heavily spoken in Sao Tome & Principe

Name: Africa Central:National Language (Sangho)
Description: Primary language of the Central African Republic (though there is a lot of French there too). Spoken in Sao Paolo in Brazil and the Central African Republic

Name: Africa Easterm:National Language (Oromo)
Description: The primary language of Ethiopia (though Amharic is spoken almost as much and is more associated generally with the country). Spoken by the Oromo people

Name: Africa Eastern:Language (Afar)
Description: One of the languages spoken in Djibouti by the Afar ethnic group

Name: Africa Eastern:Language (Amharic)
Description: Spoken in Ethiopia

Name: Africa Eastern:Language (Nyanja)
Description: A very common language in Zambia

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Bemba)
Description: The primary language of Zambia (though Nyanja is almost as possible)

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Chewa/Chichewa)
Description: Primary language of Malawi (though a good number speak English as well). Spoken in Malawi, Zimbabew, Mozambique and Zambia as one of the Bantu languages

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Comorian/Shikomoro)
Description: Primary language of the Comoros as one of the Bantu Languages

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Creole - Mauritius)
Description: The primary language of Mauritius (though most speak French and some speak English)

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Creole - Seychelles)
Description: The primary language of the Seychelles (the most also speak English)

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Kinyarwanda)
Description: The primary language of Rwanda. Spoken in Rwanda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Kirundi)
Description: The primary language of Burundi. Spoken in Burundi, Tanzania, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Luganda)
Description: The primary language of Uganda (though many speak English)

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Marshallese)
Description: Primary language spoken in the Marshall Islands and Mauritius

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Nuer/Dinka)
Description: The primary closesly related languages of South Sudan

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Somali)
Description: Primary language of Djibouti (though Afar is spoken nearly as much), Somalia and Somaliland (though a good number in Somalia and Somaliland speak Arabic).

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Swahili)
Description: The primary language of Kenya (though other Bantu languages like Kikuyu, Oluhyia and Kamba are very common as well as Nilotic group languages). Spoken in Kenya, Rwanda, Tanzania (though not spoken much as there isn't much of a primary language there) and Uganda

Name: Africa Eastern:National Language (Tigrinya)
Description: The primary language of Eritrea (though Tigre/Dahlik is heavily spoken there too). Spoken in Eritrea

Name: Africa Eastern:Native Language (Makhuwa/Makua)
Description: The native language of the Makua people who make up the largest ethnic group in Mozambique, a Bantu language

Name: Africa Southern: National Language (Tswana/Setswana)
Description: The primary language of Botswana.

Name: Africa Southern:Language (Afrikaans)
Description: Spoken widely in South Africa and Namibia

Name: Africa Southern:National Language (Malagasy)
Description: Primary language of Madagascar (though a good number can speak French)

Name: Africa Southern:National Language (Oshiwambo)
Description: The primary language of Namibia primarily spoken by the Ovambo ethnic group

Name: Africa Southern:National Language (Sotho/Sesotho/Southern Sotho)
Description: Primary language of Lesotho. Spoken in Lesotho and South Africa as part of the Bantu langague group

Name: Africa Southern:National Language (Swazi/siSwazi)
Description: Primary language of Eswatini (formerly called Swaziland). Spoken in Eswatini and South Africa by the Nguni people as part of the Bantu language group

Name: Africa Southern:National Language (Zulu)
Description: The primary language of South Africa (though Xhosa, Afrikaans and English are understood in urban areas as there isn't much informity of language overall in the country)

Name: Africa Western: National Language (Mossi)
Description: The primary language of Burkina Faso as part of the Gur Languages (though French is the official language it isn't widely used).

Name: Africa Western:Language (Akan)
Description: Spoken heavily in Ghana by the Aja people

Name: Africa Western:Language (Baule/Bawule)
Description: A language spoken heavily in Ivory Coast

Name: Africa Western:Language (Ewe)
Description: Spoken heavily in Ghana and Togo

Name: Africa Western:Language (Fulfulde/Maasina)
Description: Heavily spoken in Mali by the Fula people of the Senegambian language group

Name: Africa Western:Language (Mende)
Description: A language spoken heavily in southern Sierra Leone

Name: Africa Western:Language (Soninke/Marka/Maraka)
Description: Spoken heavily in Mali. Spoken in Mali, Mauritania and Senegal as part of the Mande languages

Name: Africa Western:Language (Yoruba)
Description: Spoken heavily in Nigeria and also in Benin by the Yoruba people

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Bambara/Bamanankan)
Description: Primary language of Mali (though a decent number speak French) by it's primary ethnic group the Bambara people as one of the Manding Languages

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Creole - Cape Verde)
Description: The primary language of Guinea-Bissau

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Creole - Sierra Leone/Krio)
Description: The primary language of Sierra Leone (though many speak Temne and Mende)

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Fula/Pular)
Description: Primary language of Guinea. Spoken heavily in The Gambia. Spoken in Benin, Burkina Faso, Guineau, Mali, Mauritania, Niger and Sengeal

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Hausa)
Description: The primary language of Niger of the Hausa people. It is also heavily spoken in Nigeria.

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Mandinka/Mandingo)
Description: Primary language of The Gambia (though Fula and Wolof are heavily spoken there as well). Also spoken by Senegal and Guinea.

Name: Africa Western:National Language (Wolof)
Description: The primary language of Senegal (a good number also speak French). Also spoken in Mauritania.

Name: Africa Western:Native Language (Kpelle)
Description: Spoken by the largest native group in Liberia the Kpelle people and in Guinea as part of thr Mande family of languages

Name: Alcohol (Beer)
Description: A barley fermented drinkof low alcohol content commonly drank worldwide

Name: Alcohol (Cocktails/Mixology)
Description: Distilled spirits mixed with syrups, bitters and juices to create food products from alcohol

Name: Alcohol (Gin)
Description: A juniper and sage based distilled spirit associated with the united kingdom, it has a much higher alcohol content then beer or wine

Name: Alcohol (Homebrewing)
Description: Creating alcoholic drinks at home

Name: Alcohol (Mead)
Description: Wine made from honey

Name: Alcohol (Rum)
Description: A sugarcane based distilled spirit associated with the carribean, it has a much higher alcohol content then beer or wine

Name: Alcohol (Tequila/Mezcal)
Description: An agave based distilled spirit associated with mexico, it has a much higher alcohol content then beer or wine

Name: Alcohol (Whisky/ey - General)
Description: A corn or barley based distilled spirit associated with america, ireland and scotland, it has a much higher alcohol content then beer or wine

Name: Alcohol (Wine/Winemaking)
Description: A grapes based fermented drink of higher alcohol content then beer

Name: Animation (Stop Motion)
Description: Creating films using a sequence of posed photographs to create the illusion of movement, such as in Wallace & Gromit or Robot Chicken

Name: Animation (Traditional)
Description: Creating films using a sequence of hand drawn images to create the illusion of movement, such as in early disney works, american cartoons or in Japanese animation

Name: Aquarium (Aquascape Art)
Description: Maintaing a water tank based environment where the focus is on the aesthetic and appearance of things within the tank

Name: Aquarium (General)
Description: Maintaing a water tank based environment with many sub-disciplines

Name: Aquarium (Jars/Self-Sustaining)
Description: Aquarium (Jars/Self-Sustaining)

Name: Aquarium (Plants)
Description: Maintaing a water tank based environment where the focus is on cultivating underwater plants

Name: Aquarium (Reef)
Description: Maintaing a salt water tank based environment, typically which salt water creatures
Equipment: Aquarium Tank, Aqautic Plants, Salt Water Reef Fish

Name: Architecture
Description: The art and design of creating buildings

Name: Asia Central:National Language (Kyrgyz)
Description: Primary language of Kyrgyzstan

Name: Asia Central:National Language (Persian)
Description: The primary language of Iran(Farsi) and Afghanistan. Also spoken in Tajikistan

Name: Asia Central:National Language (Punjabi)
Description: The ninth most natively spoken language in the world. The primary language of Pakistan. Spoken in India

Name: Asia Central:National Language (Tajik)
Description: The primary language of Tajikistan

Name: Asia Central:National Language (Turkmen)
Description: The primary language of Turkmenistan

Name: Asia Central:National Language (Uzbek)
Description: Primary language in Uzbekistan

Name: Asia Central:Native Language (Kazakh)
Description: The native language of Kazakhstan (though slightly more speak Russian). Spoken in Kazakhstan

Name: Asia Eastern:Language (Cantonese)
Description: Spoken in Hong Kong and Macau

Name: Asia Eastern:National Language (Japanese)
Description: The eighth most natively spoken language in the world. The primary language of Japan and Palau.

Name: Asia Eastern:National Language (Korean)
Description: The primary language of North and South Korea.

Name: Asia Eastern:National Language (Mongolian)
Description: Primary language in Mongolia (Khalkha dialect is most common)

Name: Asia Eastern:Native Language (Hokkien Taiwanese)
Description: A language spoken nearly as much in Taiwan as Mandarin and aggresively pushed over Mandarin, likely due to Taiwan's adversarial relation with China

Name: Asia South Eastern:Language (Javanese)
Description: Primary native language of Indonesia. Spoken in Java (though Indonesian and Sudanese are heavily present on the other islands since most islands have their own language).

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Burmese)
Description: Spoken in Myanmar (formerly called Burma)

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Filipino Tagalog)
Description: A version of Tagalog that is called Filipino occasionally (I think). The primary language of the Philipines (though the philipines have about 187 languages so they have a ton)

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Indonesian)
Description: The tenth most spoken language in the world. The primary language of Indonesia.

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Khmer)
Description: Primary language of Cambodia. Spoken in Cambodia

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Lao)
Description: Primary language of Laos

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Malay)
Description: The primary language of Malaysia (which has an insane number of spoken languages and a good amount of English and Hokkien Chinese speakers) and Brunei. Also spoken in Singapore and Indonesia.

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Thai)
Description: Primary language spoken in Thailand

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Language (Vietnamese)
Description: Primary language in Vietnam (though most speak English)

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Lanugage (Creole - Singapore/Singlish)
Description: The primary language of Singapore (though many speak Singaporean Mandarin Chinese)

Name: Asia South Eastern:National Lanugage (Tetum-Dili)
Description: The primary language of East Timor (though Mambai and Makase are spoken heavily and the country has many languages)

Name: Asia Southern:Language (Maithili)
Description: A language heavily spoken in Nepal in Mithila region

Name: Asia Southern:National Language (Dhivehi)
Description: Primary language spoken in the Maldives (though many speak English as well)

Name: Asia Southern:National Language (Marathi)
Description: The tenth most natively spoken language in the world. Spoken in India.

Name: Asia Southern:National Language (Nepali)
Description: Primary langauge of Nepal (though Maithali and many other languages are spoken as well)

Name: Asia Southern:National Language (Sinhala)
Description: The primary language of Sri Lanka (many also speak Tamil and English)

Name: Asia Southern:National Language (Tshangla)
Description: The primary language of Bhutan. Spoken mostly in the east.

Name: Asia Southern:Official Language (Dzongkha)
Description: The official language of Bhutan. Spoken in Bhutan

Name: Augmented Reality/AR
Description: Interactive experiences where the real world is enhanced by a digital input, commonly as a projection over live video

Name: Baking (Bread)
Description: Creating flour based food products from wheat family grains

Name: Baking (General)
Description: Creating food products using yeast and an oven to allow dough to rise

Name: Baking (Ginger Bread House)
Description: Using baked ginger bread to make works of art

Name: Basket Weaving
Description: Weaving or sewing (typically) natural fibers into baskets, mats, mesh bags or furniture

Name: Baton Twirling
Description: Using the body to spin a metal rod in a coordinated routine

Name: Beatboxing
Description: A form of vocal percussion which mimmicks drum machines without the use of an external instrument

Name: Bookbinding
Description: Physically assembling a book or codex using various methods

Name: Botox
Description: Botulism toxin injections, which are used to smoothen wrinkles and create a youthly appearance

Name: Calligraphy
Description: A visual art involving the aesthetic writing of words and sentences

Name: Candlemaking
Description: Imbuing fragrances in and generally creating candles, typically with soy or animal fats

Name: Card Tricks (Cardistry)
Description: The performance art of card flourishing

Name: Cardmaking
Description: Crafting hand made greeting cards

Name: Carving (Wood/Whitling)
Description: Carving sculptures from wood

Name: Circus (Contortion)
Description: Gymnastic performances associated with Circus, such as trapeze, silks or lyra

Name: Clothesmaking (General)
Description: Creating clothes and garments

Name: Coffee
Description: A bean tea which can be used directly or ground and mixed with milk and syrups and is high in caffeine

Name: Collecting (Action Figures)
Description: Posable toys originally targeted for youths, which commonly portray characters from cartoons or comic books

Name: Collecting (Art)
Description: Any form of art, most commonly paintings and typically expensive

Name: Collecting (Books)
Description: Traditional books

Name: Collecting (Coins)
Description: Metal currency, often from different countries of origin

Name: Collecting (Comic Books)
Description: Panel based visual novels, most commonly from the 80s and 90s and commonly portraying superheroes

Name: Collecting (Crystals)
Description: Solid materials whose atomic strucure creates a crystal latice. Many crystal enthusiasts believe crystal exposure has various benefits

Name: Collecting (D&D Dice)
Description: Crafted dice used to play tabletop roleplaying games, most commonly Dungeons and Dragons

Name: Collecting (Glass Pipes)
Description: Glass pipes commonly used for smoking tobacco or marijuana

Name: Collecting (Knives)
Description: Knives crafted via a variety of metalworking techniques and from a plethora of cultures

Name: Collecting (Marbles)
Description: Small balls made of ... well marble

Name: Collecting (Militaria)
Description: Military items like badges, uniforms and antique weaponry

Name: Collecting (Movie Memoribilia)
Description: Props, promotional material and related items relating to films

Name: Collecting (Periodic Elements)
Description: Collecting something from each element in the periodic table

Name: Collecting (Sneakers)
Description: Limited releases sneakers which are often difficult to procure

Name: Collecting (Sports Cards - Baseball)

Name: Collecting (Stamps/Philately)

Name: Collecting (Tiki Mugs)
Description: Artistic ceramic mugs associated with drinking tiki cocktails

Name: Collecting (Vinyl Records)
Description: Classically formatted discs for playing music which some believe sound better than modern digital music

Name: Cooking (Dry Aging)
Description: A technique of aging meats which develops it's flavor

Name: Cooking (Grilling)
Description: Using a grill to cook and externally char food products, commonly meat and outdoors

Name: Cooking (Sous Vide)
Description: A cooking technique where food is cooked in a vacuum sealed bag and heated in super hot water where the temperature is easy to specifically control very easily

Name: Cosplay/Costumes
Description: Creating and wearing clothes typically associated with fictional characters from geek culture such as japanese animation or video games

Name: Creative Writing (Prompts)
Description: Writing essays and novels based on community provided prompts

Name: Crocheting
Description: Creating the textile works associated with a crochet hook

Name: Dancing (Ballet)
Description: A type of highly technical performance dance which originated in the Renaissance known for being dramatic and graceful

Name: Dancing (Ballroom)
Description: A type of classical partner dance which one can compete in

Name: Dancing (BBoy/Breakdancing)
Description: An athletic type of street dancing known for spinning and floor based moves

Name: Dancing (Funk Style)
Description: A collection of street dances including popping, locking, robot, gliding and krumping

Name: Dancing (Line)
Description: A choreographed step based dance commonly associated with honky tonks and american country music

Name: Dancing (Pole)
Description: An acrobatic dance focused around a pole commonly associated with strip clubs, burlesque and erotic dancing

Name: Dancing (Salsa)
Description: A high energy latin partner dance originating in Puerto Rican and Cuban communities

Name: Dancing (Shuffling)
Description: A type of footwork based dance associated with modern music and EDM

Name: Dancing (Swing)
Description: A type of social dance associated with swing jazz or western music

Name: Diet (Fasting/Fasted Training)
Description: Fasting in order to control inflammation only to when it is useful for muscle building and to reduce digestional distress, especially from auto-immune disorders or allergies

Name: Diets (Dairy Free)
Description: Avoiding foods containing milk products like cheese and milk

Name: Diets (FODMAP)
Description: A short term diet that stops and reintroduces short chain sugar based foods known to cause intestinal distress

Name: Diets (Gluten Free)
Description: Avoiding products containing the wheat protein gluten, most commonly flour based products

Name: Diets (Keto)
Description: Designed to put a body in a rapid weight loss state called ketosis by completing subbing carbs with fats and keeping protein very high

Name: Diets (Mediterranean)
Description: Based on the traditional diets of those who live around the mediterranean sea, specifically because there is an idea that it can make you live longer

Name: Diets (Paleo)
Description: Eating based on paleolithic human diets, which avoids food that has been processed in most ways

Name: Diets (Pescatarian)
Description: A vegeterian diet with the exception of fish

Name: Diets (Vegan)
Description: Avoiding all animal based food products, for health or ethical reasons

Name: Diets (Vegetarian)
Description: Avoiding animal meat but still eating animal food products such as milk and eggs

Name: Diorama
Description: Creating miniature 3D replicas in high detail, usually of intricate scenes

Name: DJing
Description: Mixing and playing recorded electronic music for a live audience

Name: Drawing (General)
Description: Using a pen or pencil to create pictures on a medium, typically paper but often digitally in modern times

Name: Drone Video Production (FPV)
Description: High speed drones piloted via flying goggles which can perform acrobatic stunts while filming

Name: Drone Video Production (General)
Description: Flying remote controlled helicopters to record aerial footage

Name: Europe Central:National Language (Czech)
Description: Primary language of The Czech Republic. Spoken in the Czech Republic and Slovakia

Name: Europe Central:National Language (German)
Description: Primary language of Austria (though most also spek English), Germany (though about half know English), Liechtenstein (though there is a lot of English) and Switzerland (though many speak French and most speak English also). Also spoken in Belgium, Brazil, Luxembourg, Italy and Nambia.

Name: Europe Central:National Language (Hungarian)
Description: Primary language of Hungary.

Name: Europe Central:National Language (Polish)
Description: Spoken in Poland (though a good number speak English)

Name: Europe Central:National Language (Slovak)
Description: The primary language of Slovakia (though many speak English). Spoken in Slovakia and the Czech Republic

Name: Europe Central:National Language (Slovene)
Description: The primary language of Slovenia

Name: Europe Eastern:Language (Moldovan)
Description: Spoken in Moldova and Transnistria

Name: Europe Eastern:National Language (Estonian)
Description: The primary language of Estonia (though many speak Russian as well). Spoken in Estonia

Name: Europe Eastern:National Language (Latvia)
Description: Primay language spoken in Latvia (though many speak Russian as well)

Name: Europe Eastern:National Language (Lithuanian)
Description: Primary language in Lithuania (though most also speak Russian and a good number English)

Name: Europe Eastern:National Language (Ukrainian)
Description: Primary language in Ukraine (though many speak Russian) and Transnitria

Name: Europe Northern:National Language (Finnish)
Description: The primary language of Finland (thought nearly all also speak English)

Name: Europe Northern:National Language (Norwegian)
Description: Primary language of Norway (though nearly the same number of english speakers)

Name: Europe Northern:National Language (Swedish)
Description: The primary language of Sweden (though most speak English and were ranked #1 in English proficiency for many years). Also spoken in Finland and Aland.

Name: Europe South Eastern:Language (Montenegrin)
Description: Spoken in Montenegro

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Albanian)
Description: The primary language of Albania and Kosovo. Also spoken in Montenegro and North Macedonia

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Armenian)
Description: The primary language of Armenia. Spoken in Armenia and the Artsakh region of Azerbaijan

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Bosnian)
Description: Primarily spoken in Bosnia (though they have a lot of Serbian). Spoken in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The language is very similar to Serbian and Croatian.

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Croatian)
Description: Primary language of Croatia. Spoken in Croatia and Bosnia-Herzegovinia. The language is very similar to Bosnian and Serbian.

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Macedonian)
Description: Primary language of North Macedonia (a good number also speak Albanian)

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Romanian)
Description: Primary language in Romania (though many speak English) and Moldova (Moldovan)

Name: Europe South Eastern:National Language (Serbian)
Description: Primary language of Serbia (though a good number know English as well) and Montenegro (though nearly as many speak Montenegrin also). Spoke additionally in Bosnia & Herzegovinia and Kosovo. The language is very similar to Bosnian and Croatian.

Name: Europe Southern:National Language (Greek)
Description: Primary language of Greece and Cyprus. Spoken in Greece, Cyprus and Albania

Name: Europe Southern:National Language (Italian)
Description: The primary language of Italy, San Marino and Vatican City. Also spoken also in Croatia, Slovenia and Switzerland.

Name: Europe Southern:National Language (Maltese)
Description: Primary language of Malta

Name: Europe Western:Language (Irish/Irish-Gaelic/Gaelige)
Description: The native language of Ireland (though mostly spoken in the Republic of Ireland and almost the entire population speaks English as a first language as well).

Name: Europe Western:National Language (Danish)
Description: Primary language spoken in Denmark (though almost all speak English and many German). Also spoken in the Faroe Islands

Name: Europe Western:National Language (Dutch)
Description: The primary language of the Netherlands (though almost all can speak English there as well) and Belgium. Spoken in Flanders, Brussels, Aruba, Curacao, Sint Maarten and Suriname

Name: Europe Western:National Language (Luxembourgish)
Description: Primary language spoken in Luxembourg (though about half also speak English)

Name: Exercise (Bodybuilding)
Description: Performing high resistance exercises to improve muscle size and shape

Name: Exercise (Bodyweight)
Description: Bodybuilding without using gym equipment

Name: Exercise (Calisthenics)
Description: Bodyweight exercise commonly employing bars, such as those available at jungle gyms and outdoor fitness areas

Name: Exercise (Crossfit)
Description: A cross disciplinary fitness style which tests a multitude of strengths and athleticisms, sometimes competitively

Name: Exercise (General Fitness)
Description: Exercising to increase physical and cardiovascular strength and endurance

Name: Exercise (Jump-Rope)
Description: Jumping over a rope in a coordinated and very fast fashion to practice agility and endurance

Name: Exercise (Knees Over Toes)

Description: Workouts generally focused on correcting imbalances to correct posture or strain based pains

Name: Exercise (Pilates)
Description: A core focused position based workout similar to yoga which sometimes makes use of a specific exercise machine

Name: Exercise (Powerlifting)
Description: Focusing on lifting the maximum amount of weight in competition

Name: Fabrics (Cross-Stitching)
Description: A form of embroidery which uses a pattern to create a variety of pitcures

Name: Fabrics (Embroidery)
Description: Using a needle to decorate a fabric using thread or yarn

Name: Fabrics (Lace)

Name: Fabrics (Macrame)
Description: Creating textile works using knotting techniques, which commonly are hung

Name: Fabrics (Quilting)

Name: Fabrics (Rug/Mat Hooking)

Name: Fabrics (Sewing - General)

Name: Fabrics (Tapestry)
Description: A form of textile art which is woven on a loom to create large images

Name: Fashion
Description: The development of clothing aesthetics that fit certain tastes

Name: Filmmaking (General)
Description: Creating dramatic works using video, most commonly on a digital medium but rarely with film

Name: Flower Arranging
Description: Collecting and orienting flowers in a group to create aesthetically pleasing displays

Name: Flower Pressing/Ochibana
Description: Pressing and storing dried wild herbs and flowers into a medium which is typically paper based

Name: Glassblowing (Lampwork/Glass Pipes)

Name: Glassblowing (Scientific)
Description: Glasswork which focuses on creating superior glassworks which can be used for scentific experimentation

Name: Graffiti
Description: A type of street spray paint art which is typically displayed illegally in public view

Name: Graphic Design
Description: A visual discipline focusing on the effectiveness of aesthetics in achieving an outcome

Name: Hacking
Description: Bypassing digital security, often illegally

Name: Hair Care
Description: Using products to improve the quality and appearance of one's hair

Name: Hair Removal (Laser)
Description: Using a laser to permanently remove hairs from areas of the body

Name: Hair Removal (Waxing)
Description: Using wax to achieve very smooth hair removal

Name: Herbal Medicine
Description: Applying and ingesting various herbs for supposed health effects

Name: Hooping (Hula)
Description: The act of twirling a hoop around your waist without the use of your hands and it's commonly associated dances and activities

Name: Ice Bathing/Wim Hof
Description: Submerging yourself in freezing water for extended amounts of time to better control your body

Name: Instruments (Accordion)

Upcycling
